questions.title: Existing Policy Change
questions.questionHeading: Does the project involve a substantial change to an existing policy, process or system that involves personal information
questions.description:
Example: New legislation or policy that makes it compulsory to collect or disclose information

If No, please write No.
If Yes, please explain your response.

questions.title: Risk Register Activity
questions.questionHeading: Does the project involve any practice or activity that is listed on a risk register kept by the Transport Agency
questions.description:
Example: Practices or activities listed on the Transport Agency’s risk register or health and safety register

If No, please write No.
If Yes, please explain your response.

questions.title: New Collection of PII
questions.questionHeading: Does the project involve a new collection of personal information
questions.description:
Example: Collecting information about individuals’ location

If No, please write No.
If Yes, please explain your response.

questions.title: New Way of Collecting PII
questions.questionHeading: Does the project involve a new way of collecting personal information
questions.description:
Example: Collecting information online rather than on paper forms

If No, please write No.
If Yes, please explain your response.

questions.title: Change in PII Storage
questions.questionHeading: Does the project involve a change in the way personal information is stored or secured
questions.description:
Example: Storing information in the cloud

If No, please write No.
If Yes, please explain your response.

questions.title: Sensitive Information
questions.questionHeading: Does the project involve a change to how sensitive information is managed
questions.description:
Example: Moving health or financial records to a new database

If No or your Information classification is not Sensitive, please write No.
If Yes, please explain your response.

questions.title: Transferring PII Offshore
questions.questionHeading: Does the project involve transferring personal information offshore or using a third-party contractor
questions.description:
Example: Outsourcing the payroll function or storing information in the cloud

If No, please write No.
If Yes, please explain your response.

questions.title: Longer PII Retention
questions.questionHeading: Does the project involve a decision to keep personal information for longer than you have previously
questions.description:
Example: Changing IT backups to be kept for 10 years when you previously only stored them for 7

If No, please write No.
If Yes, please explain your response.

questions.title: A New Use or Disclosure
questions.questionHeading: Does the project involve a new use or disclosure of personal information that is already held
questions.description:
Example: Sharing information with other parties in a new way

If No, please write No.
If Yes, please explain your response.

questions.title: Sharing or Matching
questions.questionHeading: Does the project involve sharing or matching personal information held by different organisations or currently held in different datasets
questions.description:
Example: Combining information with other information held on public registers, or sharing information to enable organisations to provide services jointly

If No, please write No.
If Yes, please explain your response.

questions.title: Individuals' Access
questions.questionHeading: Does the project involve a change in policy that results in people having less access to information that you hold about them
questions.description:
Example: Archiving documents after 6 months into a facility from which they can’t be easily retrieved

If No, please write No.
If Yes, please explain your response.

questions.title: Identifying Individuals
questions.questionHeading: Does the project involve establishing a new way of identifying individuals
questions.description:
Example: A unique identifier, a biometric, or an online identity system

If No, please write No.
If Yes, please explain your response.

questions.title: Searching PII
questions.questionHeading: Does the project involve introducing a new system for searching individuals’ property, persons or premises
questions.description:
Example: A phone company adopts a new policy of searching data in old phones that are handed in

If No, please write No.
If Yes, please explain your response.

questions.title: Surveillance
questions.questionHeading: Does the project involve surveillance, tracking or monitoring of movements, behaviour or communications
questions.description:
Example: Installing a new CCTV system

If No, please write No.
If Yes, please explain your response.

questions.title: Private Spaces
questions.questionHeading: Does the project involve changes to your premises that will involve private spaces where clients or customers may disclose their personal information
questions.description:
Example: Changing the location of the reception desk, where people may discuss personal details

If No, please write No.
If Yes, please explain your response.

questions.title: Regulatory Requirements
questions.questionHeading: Does the project involve new regulatory requirements that could lead to compliance action against individuals on the basis of information about them
questions.description:
Example: Adding a new medical condition to the requirements of a drivers licence

If No, please write No.
If Yes, please explain your response.

questions.title: Other
questions.questionHeading: Does the project involve anything else that may impact on privacy, such as bodily searches, or intrusions into physical space
questions.description:
If No, please write No.
If Yes, please explain your response.

questions.title: Risk Assessment
questions.questionHeading: Did you answer 'Yes' to any of the previous questions?

questions.title: Level of Information Handling
questions.questionHeading: Please Define the level of information handling involved by this product
questions.description:
Low – Minimal personal information will be handled
Medium – A moderate amount of personal information (or information that could become personal information) will be handled
High – A significant amount of personal information (or information that could become personal information) will be handled

questions.title: Information Sensitivity
questions.questionHeading: Sensitivity of the information (eg health, financial, race)
questions.description:
Low – The information will not be sensitive
Medium – The information may be considered to be sensitive
High – The information will be highly sensitive

questions.title: Significance of Changes
questions.questionHeading: Significance of Changes
questions.description:
Low – Only minor change to existing functions/activities
Medium – Substantial change to existing functions/activities; or a new initiative
High – Major overhaul of existing functions/activities; or a new initiative that’s significantly different

questions.title: Interaction With Others
questions.questionHeading: Interaction With Others
questions.description:
Low – No interaction with other agencies
Medium – Interaction with one or two other agencies
High – Extensive cross-agency (that is, government) interaction or cross-sectional (non-government and government) interaction

questions.title: Public Impact
questions.questionHeading: Public Impact
questions.description:
Low – Minimal impact on the Transport Agency and clients
Medium – Some impact on clients is likely due to changes to the handling of personal information; or the changes may raise public concern
High – High impact on clients and the wider public, and concerns over aspects of project; or negative media is likely

questions.title: Finish
questions.questionHeading: Finish
